name: Fixes for JJAT
body:
JJAT still uses an older version of the lib, which has seen some slight modifications in the past.

## Changes

- Remove semaphore from the audio subsystem
- Clear the screen to black
- Fix retrieving an audio file's length on Linux
- Refactor the Makefile to support concurrently building for multiple targets
- Stop removing '.dat' from "optimized" asset files

name: Implement continuous collision
body:
## Important Note

Version 3.X.Y is still on development and it may break compatibility between its own versions.

## Overall Modifications

- Fix "off-by-1" bugs during collision. **This may break compatibility with currently existing games!**
- Add support to continuous collision
- Refactor quadtree so it uses `gfmHitbox` for its areas (instead of a custom object)

## Function added

+ **gfmObject_enableContinousCollision:** Enable continuous collision for the object (usually only checked when adding it to the quadtree)
+ **gfmObject_getCollisionBoundary:** Retrieve the current boundaries of the object. If continuous collision is enabled, it spawns the entire area occupied by the object since the previous frame.
+ **gfmObject_sweepJustOverlaped:** Check if two objects may have overlapped since the previous frame. It detects even when objects complete pass through each other (regardless of whether or not continuous collision is enabled).
+ **gfmObject_sweepCollision:** Separate two objects even even when objects complete pass through each other (regardless of whether or not continuous collision is enabled). One of the objects must be considered static for this to work!
+ **gfmSprite_sweepJustOverlaped:** Same as `gfmObject_sweepJustOverlaped`, but for sprites.
+ **gfmSprite_sweepCollision:** Same as `gfmObject_sweepCollision`, but for sprites.
+ **gfmQuadtree_enableContinuosCollision:** Enable continuous collision for every object on the quadtree.
+ **gfmQuadtree_disableContinuosCollision:** Disable continuous collision for every object on the quadtree.

name: Fix cross-compiling
body:
## Overall Modifications

- Remove `strnlen` declaration when cross-compiling
- Fix warning issued by MinGW-W64

name: Add cross-compiling support
body:
## Overall Modifications

- Modify Makefile so it may be easily used for cross-compiling on Linux
- `DEBUG=yes` mode may be compiled along side `RELEASE=yes`
- `install` must be run once per mode (`DEBUG` and `RELEASE`)
- Modify Windows version to use SDL2 backend for file IO
- Remove weird inline from `gfmGeometry` "module"
- Fix issue with `gframe_lots_of_particles_tst` demo

## Function added

- **gfmFile_peekChar:** Lookup the next character on a file without "consuming" it

name: Fix lingering input bug
body:
## Overall Modification

- The bug (stick key on single-frame input) was finally fixed for keyboard input as well

name: Fix all previously known input bugs
body:
## Overall Modifications

- Framework now (as expected) respect the device's state
    - If the user taps a key, it will be set as justPressed for a frame and released on the following
    - If the user taps a key and then presses and hold it, it will correctly maintain the pressed state
    - If the user release and press a previously pressed key within a single frame, it will detect the new press and keep it pressed afterward
- It's now possible to press a key within two frames (i.e., press on frame 1 and then release+press on frame 2)

name: Fix frame-perfect input bug
body:
## Overall Modifications

- Fix dropping release input events if they occurred on the same frame as the press one (for the same key).

## Know bugs

- From this version onward, key presses are only detected if there's been at least one frame since the key was released.

name: Add gfmHitbox type
body:
## Overall Modifications

- Allow cancelling `gfm_getLastPressed` operation
- Properly quit all initialized subsystems
- Fix drawing with multiples textures
- Allow applying an object's translation into another one
- Refactor part of `gfmObject` into a `gfmHitbox`, a object that represents static geometry (rectangles) in world space
    - `gfmObject` now has a `gfmHitbox` and its physics properties

## Functions Added

* **gfmHitbox_getNewList:** Create a sequenctially alloc'ed list of hitboxes
* **gfmHitbox_free:** Releases a list of hitboxes
* **gfmHitbox_init:** Initialize a single hitbox
* **gfmHitbox_initItem:** Initialize a single hitbox within a list
* **gfmHitbox_getItem:** Retrieve a hitbox from a list
* **gfmHitbox_populateQuadtree:** Add hitboxes to a quadtree
* **gfmHitbox_collideSubList:** Collide a sub-set of a list of hitboxes
* **gfmInput_cancelRequestLastPressed:** Cancel a `gfm_getLastPressed` operation
* **gfmObject_applyDelta:** Apply an object's translation into another
* **gfmObject_applyDeltaX:** Apply an object's horizontal translation into another
* **gfmObject_applyDeltaY:** Apply an object's vertical translation into another
* **gfmObject_justOverlapedHitbox:** Check for overlap between an object and a hitbox on this frame
* **gfmObject_separateHorizontalHitbox:** Separate horizontally an object and a hitbox
* **gfmObject_separateVerticalHitbox:** Separate vertically an object and a hitbox
* **gfmObject_collideHitbox:** Collide an object against a hitbox
* **gfmObject_setType:** Set an object's type
* **gfmSprite_applyDelta:** Apply an sprite's translation into another
* **gfmSprite_applyDeltaX:** Apply an sprite's horizontal translation into another
* **gfmSprite_applyDeltaY:** Apply an sprite's vertical translation into another
* **gfmTilemap_getTypeAt:** Retrieve the type of a tile on a given pixel position
* **gfm_cancelGetLastPressed:** Cancel a `gfm_getLastPressed` operation

name: Collision primitives & Debug Font & more
body:
## Disclaimer

This release adds a bitmap font based on [Daniel Linssen's m3x6 font](https://managore.itch.io/m3x6). It's intended to be used only for debug (and is even removed from the release build).

## Overall Modifications
- Add internal fixed number module
- Add internal basic geometric primitives for collision
- Implement collision between `gfmObject`/`gfmSprite` and lines
- Add new collision modes for `gfmGroup`
- Fix segfault when trying to render a quadtree node with a "negative type" (it should had always been unsigned)
- Fix retrieval of all available resolutions
- Export definition of `gfmObject_justOverlaped`
- Fix loss of precision when re-positioning objects during collision
- Refactor how textures are loaded (lessen duplicated code)
- Add function to load textures from arrays
- Add static font for debug printing in screen-space
- Add printf-like debug function for printing in screen-space
- Refactor gfmObject to use verlet integration for its movement
- Sprite from a gfmGroup's node may now be retrieved
- Make it easier to check if object is inside camera
- Allow positioning objects by their centers
- Positioning an object inside another will trigger overlap but won't set its flag for either side.

## Functions Added
- **gfmDebug_printf:** Printf-like function for rendering debug info on the screen
- **gfmObject_setCenter:** Set position an object based on its center
- **gfmObject_justOverlaped:** Check if a sprite just overlapped another (was only missing on the module's header)
- **gfmObject_overlapLine:** Check if an object is overlapping a 2D line
- **gfmQuadtree_setStatic:** Set the quadtree so collisions won't add new nodes to it (useful for batching level geometry)
- **gfmSprite_setCenter:** Set position a sprite based on its center
- **gfmSprite_justOverlaped:** Check if a sprite just overlapped another
- **gfmSprite_overlapLine:** Check if a sprite is overlapping a 2D line
- **gfm_isObjectInsideCamera:** Check if an object is inside the camera

name: Android, Async loading & "Steppable debug"
body:
## Known Issues

**The Makefile for Windows is broken. It requires a few modifications to work, which will be patched soon.**

## Overall Modifications
- Optimizes sorting of gfmGroup
- FPS Counter position may be set
- gfmGroup's nodes doesn't have to be of the same type
- Enhances coloring of nodes in quadtree
  > The color of a node in the quadtree is defined by the last 5 bits in the object type, enabling a total of 32 colors. This may be used to set the color of "classes" of objects (e.g., player 1 type = 0x101, player 2 type = 0x201, enemy 1 = 0x11f, enemy 2 = 0x21f etc).
- Add support for Android through Android NDK (see GGJ16's [config.sh](https://github.com/SirGFM/ggj16/blob/gfm_new/android_build/config.sh) for how to use it... And good luck!)
- Assets may be loaded in background
- Add 'attribute' to parser's type
  > An 'attribute' has any number of key/value pairs. For example, an object may be seen as an area followed by attributes.
- Fixes invalid memory accesses
- Add software backend to renderer
- Fix collision of objects manually positioned
- Add (**untested!!**) Mac OS X target
- Tilemap doesn't need to be on the top left corner.
  > The first non-transparent is used to calculate the offset of the tilemap, which may be useful for storing multiple maps in a single "master tilemap".

## Functions added
- **gfm_setFPSCounterPos:** Set the position where the FPS counter is to be rendered.
- **gfm_pauseAudio:** Pause the audio player.
- **gfm_resumeAudio:** Resume the audio player.
- **gfm_stopAudio:** Stop a single audio.
- **gfm_loadAssetsAsync:** Loads a list of assets asynchronously.
- **gfm_resetFPS:** Reset accumulated frames. Useful when loading assets in background (e.g., when moving from a "loading scene" into either a menu or the game).
- **gfmAudio_queueAudio:** Queue an audio to be played as soon as the audio player is running.
- **gfmGroup_killAll:** Put all sprites in this group on the recycled list
- **gfmGroup_setType:** Set the type of the last recycled/added sprite. Useful when every node in a group has a inferred real type (e.g., gfmSprite), but should be interpreted as a different type (e.g., particleA, particleB, bullet etc).
- **gfmInput_updateVKey:** Update a single virtual key. Required to decouple updating keys from the main loop, which enables pressing a key to step a single frame.
- **gfmSave_findId:** Search for a given ID in a file.
- **gfmSprite_setType:** Required by gfmGroup_setType.

name: Version 2.0.0
body:
First 'official' release.
- Android support is missing. It will be done after implementing an OpenGL ES video backend.

name: Version by the end of LD#33
body: Fixed lots of bugs. Still no gamepad support, so it's only a release candidate.

name: Pre-LD33 version (2)
body:
Since audio may not work properly*, added a function to completely remove it. Now, ignoring the audio is as simple as running the game with a command-line option.

*My desktop runs everything just fine, but my notebook either run the game at around 10 FPS and slowing the audio a lot or it has a pretty long delay (a few seconds).

name: Pre-LD33 version
body:
"Release candidate" version to be used by anyone trying to compile my LD#33 entry. This is the latest stable version, prior to LD#33.

All assets used on the tests are on the annexed zip file. Note that the assets folder must be on the same as the binaries (so [...]/GFraMe/bin/<OS>/tst/).

name: Fixed audio bug & Draw rate
body:
Small bugfix.
- Removes a BGM if it stopped playing;
- Added function to modify BGM's volume
- Draw rate was being assigned from update rate; now it is properly set from the requested draw rate.

name: Collision fixes + screen resizeable
body:
Fixed some collision bugs and added functions to resize the screen from within the code.

Also, I'll probably refactor the whole lib for the next tag.

name: Ludum Dare #31 version
body: Main modification was addition of keyboard and game pad wrappers. There're still game pad compatibility problems.

name: Example now supports Android 2.3.3
body:
This release was used to create a build for Windows and Linux (two .debs).

Also, support to Android 2.3.3 was later added.

The framework is still highly undocumented, and it requires some fixes to its error handling.

name: Example game released
body:
This release has all the framework and example game as it was when first releasing it.

There are still many undocumented features and some points where errors should be throughly checked.
